greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smaller central (median) divisor of n!.
comment: Between this d and its complementary divisor, the integer part of square root of n! is situated; for n=6: {24,26,30}.
link: Terentyev Oleg, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..59
example: Divisors of 6!=720 are {1,2,3,4,5,6,...,24,30,...,360,720}. a(6)=24, the 15th divisor from 30 divisors of 720.
mathematica: Table[ Part[ Divisors[ w! ], Floor[ DivisorSigma[ 0, n! ]/2 ] ], {w, a, b} ]
program: (PARI) a(n) = if (n==1, 1, my(d=divisors(n!)); d[#d\2]); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Sep 16 2018
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Apr 26 2001
